have a bipartite

matching corresponds to finding a   maximum flow in this, if I get any maximum flow,

g, it

then I put a capacity one constraint

d be bipartite 
matching. So, we want to solve A, what we know   how to solve is something else. So, this is

because we have the Ford Fulkerson algorithm,   what we no

c0d37342-aa57-4866-9308-0c22437792ff.title: Reductions
c0d37342-aa57-4866-9308-0c22437792ff.chunk:
w do is convert our problem from

once we have a network flow problem,

we have a   solution for that network flow problem. So, the

case, the edges which have flow correspond to the   edges which will be allocated in the match

2816b382-e8e4-4f0b-aa9c-ce9163f458d1.title: Reductions
2816b382-e8e4-4f0b-aa9c-ce9163f458d1.chunk:
ing.
So, we can now reverse this thing and reconstruct   from the answer that the algorithm B gives us,

this is what we wanted it, given A we wanted   the answ

e15eced0-42f4-4a01-b1d4-37c0cfe0aa07.title: Reductions
e15eced0-42f4-4a01-b1d4-37c0cfe0aa07.chunk:
er that A should provide for X. 
So, what we do is we pass that answer,   the question to B look at the answer of B, and 
then reconstruct. So, this is a reduction.
  So, we say that A reduces to B. If I can solve B 
I can solve A. So, solving A reduces to

1538fbca-07e9-4c97-ad08-3e6084029197.title: Reductions
1538fbca-07e9-4c97-ad08-3e6084029197.chunk:
solving B.   So, if we do this, as we have seen if you could

you can transfer an efficient solution for B   to an efficient solution for A, provided it does 
not

e01aadf8-922a-4bca-ab90-e91405076b43.chunk:
take you too long to do these two steps.
  And you know that this step is going to be 
quick, then combined the whole thing is going   to be quick, I have after do some work, call this 
B, get the answer from B which will be quick and   then reconstruct t

08cde799-9020-45a9-bc15-842bbbcf48cc.title: Reductions
08cde799-9020-45a9-bc15-842bbbcf48cc.chunk:
he answer for A. So, this 
is a typical scenario of using reduction. So,   we have seen many such things. So, we have

that you could take a specific problem invo

1ebfb59f-68a1-4d8e-99fb-aa3b254344f6.title: Reductions
1ebfb59f-68a1-4d8e-99fb-aa3b254344f6.chunk:
lving   sort of carpet sales or involving making

in a sense because those are concrete problems,   which I am modeling as reduction, whereas 
here we have taken o

753adf04-be49-4af4-abab-3f33ce9c6a65.title: Reductions
753adf04-be49-4af4-abab-3f33ce9c6a65.chunk:
ne problem in one domain,   I can take bipartite matching over arbitrary 
bipartite graphs, and any search problem.
  So, there is a whole class of problems called 
bipartite matching, I can take this entire   class of problems and solve it using a class

abccf5df-bd0d-4b82-bd4b-5f88e72ee906.title: Reductions
abccf5df-bd0d-4b82-bd4b-5f88e72ee906.chunk:
of problems called network flow. So, that is   the reduction thing. I can take any bipartite 
matching problem and convert it to a specific   network flow problem and reconstruct the answer. 
So, that is the reduction power. It is not saying   that you mod

8f838315-a9f3-4d8a-a7d4-607cdaeff068.title: Reductions
8f838315-a9f3-4d8a-a7d4-607cdaeff068.chunk:
el one question in terms of some 
formulism but you are saying that every problem   of type A can be transformed into a problem of 
type B and the answer can be reconstructed.
  So, when we say efficient, what we will usually 
mean as we will go ahead is t

1ccfa9e9-12d5-4c12-a63a-00e0988b64a7.title: Reductions
1ccfa9e9-12d5-4c12-a63a-00e0988b64a7.chunk:
hat both these   translations should be in polynomial time with 
respect to the size of the input of A. And the   size of the output of B must also not be 
too large, because I have to reconstruct   back in polynomial time an answer for A.
So, in this sens

ae313dc8-2d69-4f02-a259-98632787c14b.title: Reductions
ae313dc8-2d69-4f02-a259-98632787c14b.chunk:
e bipartite matching reduces   to maximum flow. Last time, we saw that

a variable, then we can write these constraints   which express the fact that the flows

c36618a0-d301-4e67-b01a-2de2a06ec0fd.chunk:
respect 
the capacities of the edges and at each node,   there is a conservation of flow, the incoming 
flow must add up to the outgoing flow.

of constraints one is the capacity constraints,   one is thi

bf09d46c-d954-4562-86c6-4863e0c816f0.chunk:
s conservation constraint, and then we 
have this objective function which is maximize the   flow through the edges coming out of the source.

have just see

n and there could be other problems,   which we are not going to addressed here,

progra

53004503-a632-4091-97a4-dbfc551059ce.title: Reductions
53004503-a632-4091-97a4-dbfc551059ce.chunk:
mming by adding one variable per   edge, then the number of variables is now

have one capacity constrained per edge, and we   have one conservation constraint per

316486b7-ae2c-41c2-8203-f51f72f34c8b.chunk:
node.
So, the problem in this pre-processing which   converts should not create to larger 
solution. So, that is the real goal   of making a reduction effective in terms 
of translating efficient solutions.   So, this is the positive use of reductions in

63833f4a-7742-4be8-aacd-acb467639526.title: Reductions
63833f4a-7742-4be8-aacd-acb467639526.chunk:
some 
sense. So, we can take a problem that we know how   to solve and use it to solve another problem.
Now, there is also another way of interpreting   reductions. Supposing, I do not know how to 
solve A, supposing I do not know how to solve A,   so I kn

e56ac206-d39f-4ac9-afe3-fa8228b56643.title: Reductions
e56ac206-d39f-4ac9-afe3-fa8228b56643.chunk:
ow that solving A is hard. Now, I want 
to check whether solving B is also hard. So,   supposing I can reduce A to B in the same way, 
then I claim that B must also be hard because   if I could solve B easily, then I have 
a simple way of solving A easily.

7f876d76-972e-498c-a2f7-4a550847060d.title: Reductions
7f876d76-972e-498c-a2f7-4a550847060d.chunk:
But since I believe that A is hard to solve, it 
cannot be easy to solve B. So, this is a kind of   an argument which would be difficult to do on 
your own. How do you look at a problem and say   that this problem is going to all instances this 
problem

1357ffd3-b9ef-4800-9a94-bc3cefb0abdd.title: Reductions
1357ffd3-b9ef-4800-9a94-bc3cefb0abdd.chunk:
are hard to solve. So, on a specific   problem, it is hard, it is difficult to do this, 
but if I know some other problem, where somebody   has already done this hard work and established 
that that problem is difficult to solve.
  If I can reduce that pr

821deb67-5fa8-470c-bc2b-8404542e4891.title: Reductions
821deb67-5fa8-470c-bc2b-8404542e4891.chunk:
oblem to my problem, 
then I can argue that my problem must be as   difficult as that one because if I could solve 
this one easily, then through this reduction,   I can transfer it back. So, this says basically 
that if I can solve B efficiently, I can so

a537610b-4d8e-4866-b9ba-8b395578e5f6.title: Reductions
a537610b-4d8e-4866-b9ba-8b395578e5f6.chunk:
lve   A efficiently. So, conversely, if I cannot solve 
A efficiently, I cannot solve B efficiently.

programming and network flows is not   to examine the algorithms for these we just gave 
a sketchy version of th

bcabcdea-2749-41f1-84a7-794fe1905ba5.title: Reductions
bcabcdea-2749-41f1-84a7-794fe1905ba5.chunk:
e simplex version for how   simplex works for linear programming. And we

actually proving that they are correct.   But the point is that these are big hammers.
So,

0a61a043-e76e-4b2d-b248-e339dd61d30c.title: Reductions
0a61a043-e76e-4b2d-b248-e339dd61d30c.chunk:
these are very powerful techniques, which are   available to us to solve a lot of problems. So,

useful problems. There are commercially   available or even non commerc

6660c5a0-f59d-4ae8-87f0-f04957a06697.title: Reductions
6660c5a0-f59d-4ae8-87f0-f04957a06697.chunk:
ially available, 
publicly available libraries to solve these.   So, if you are using Python, or if you 
are using some other programming language,   you will find a way to call a library which can 
solve a linear programming problem for you.
  And if you

9292f3c9-eda7-4e4a-8274-e15041b166fe.title: Reductions
9292f3c9-eda7-4e4a-8274-e15041b166fe.chunk:
can model your problem in terms 
of linear programming, then all you have to   do is call this library. So, therefore, it is 
useful to be able to do this translation. So,   this is a different aspect from the rest 
of the course, where we will be looking

892a7055-e64b-4d12-bd7b-166c8981a3af.title: Reductions
892a7055-e64b-4d12-bd7b-166c8981a3af.chunk:
at designing and analysing specific 
algorithms for specific problems.
  Here, we are saying that these are these   very powerful problems which can be 
solved and for which solutions exist.   So, can you take your problem and interpret 
it as a linear p

0d024183-906d-4ba1-a767-ba1f22b5efa4.title: Reductions
0d024183-906d-4ba1-a767-ba1f22b5efa4.chunk:
rogramming problem? Or can you   take a problem and interpret it as a network 
problem and then apply the technique that we   generally applies to linear programming 
and network flow in order to solve?
